comments: This is example 42 in Guy's paper. The first seven terms are the same as the Fibonacci sequence A000045. Subsequent terms deviate from Fibonacci. - _T. D. Noe_, May 08 2006
references: N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
links: R. K. Guy, Letter to N. J. A. Sloane, 1988-04-12 (annotated scanned copy)
R. K. Guy, The Second Strong Law of Small Numbers, Math. Mag, 63 (1990), no. 1, 3-20.
Richard Laatsch, Measuring the abundancy of integers, Mathematics Magazine 59 (2) (1986) 84-92.
crossrefs: Cf. A005579 (least number of distinct prime factors in even numbers having an abundancy index >n).
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, _R. K. Guy_, Apr 12 1988
extensions: More terms from _Harvey P. Dale_, Aug 07 2013
